Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt and Nestor Cortes combined on a four-hit shutout against the Cubs.
The Cubs were held scoreless for the 15th time this season.
Cubs outfielder Cody Bellinger struck out in the sixth inning.
Cubs left fielder Ian Happ committed an error while fielding a ball hit by the Yankees' Anthony Rizzo in the second inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Ian Happ expressed that the team feels they have a good enough ballclub to be in the playoffs but need to play better.
Cubs President Jed Hoyer mentioned the confusion caused by the fickle winds of Wrigley Field affecting the offense.
Manager Craig Counsell discussed the challenges of predicting weather conditions and emphasized the need to be prepared for both pitcher-friendly and hitter-friendly situations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was attended by a crowd of 40,080 on a sun-chilled September afternoon.
The Cubs' playoff odds stood at 1.1% before the game.
The Cubs have a 72-70 record with 20 games left in the season.
The Cubs ranked 27th with a .667 OPS in home games compared to a 10th-ranked .738 OPS in road games.
The wind blew in on Saturday for the 33rd time at Wrigley in 70 home games, and the Cubs are 12-21 when it does.
The Cubs pitchers ranked second in home ERA (3.22) and 21st on the road (4.36).
The series concludes with a matchup of Gerrit Cole and Jameson Taillon, and the Cubs will induct Kerry Wood and Aramis Ramirez into their Hall of Fame.
Yankees first baseman Anthony Rizzo received a standing ovation during the second inning.
